ovdesc.p: This file is used only in conjunction with the T24 GUI.
Records on this file are used to define enquiries that are linked either to applications, versions or specific felds within applications or versions.

Where the key refers to either an application, these records are used to list the enquiries that may be run on any field that has that related file. In addition, contract enquiries may be specified by application and version, e.g. the record LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS on this file will hold a list of enquiries that may be run from the LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS application. Enquiries defined in a version record will appear in addition to any defined for the application.

Where a file name (and optionally version) and a field is specified, then this record pertains to the context sensitive enquiries that are available for the field. These enquiries are grouped together on the Enquiry Menu by application, or application and version.

All of the enquiries available may be launched from both the Enquiry Menu, and also from the pop-up menu in the contract input screen. The pop-up menu appears whenever the mouse is right clicked on a field.
In addition, enquiries may be set to autolaunch either at field level, or at validation of a function.

The selection field of the enquiry which references the customer file is the LIABILITY.NUMBER selection field. This information should be defined here.
For enquiries that are set to auto-launch at F5, additional functionality allows further specification, in the form.

Where the record refers to a specific field, that is a field name has been set in the key, this field determines whether the associated enquiry will automatically be launched once input to this field is complete.
Where the record refers to a file, the functions that will trigger the automatic launch of the enquiry are defined here.The launch occurs once any of the functions defined are completed.
For field level records, only input of YES or NO is allowed.

Records that refer to applications, or applications and versions allow the definition of functions. Valid Function codes are: A 2 C D E H I L P Q R S V If NOT is entered, plus one or more Function codes, the System converts it to a list of all the functions that are allowed. 0-29 type S (uppercase alpha or numeric) characters: 1. Function codes separated by spaces or 2. NOT + one or more Function codes or 3. NO (No trigger produced) or 4. ALL (All Functions produce the trigger).
Autolauching of enquiries is possible when the record is put on HOLD by specifying "O" Function on AUTO.LAUNCH.
